Tokyo.name: Shinjuku Gyoen National Garden
Tokyo.description: Uno de los parques más grandes y populares de Tokio, con jardines de estilo inglés, francés y japonés.

Tokyo.name: Omoide Yokocho
Tokyo.description: Conocido como "Piss Alley", es un callejón estrecho lleno de pequeños bares y restaurantes de yakitori.

Tokyo.name: Kabukicho
Tokyo.description: El distrito de entretenimiento más grande de Japón, lleno de bares, restaurantes y vida nocturna.

Tokyo.name: Tokyo Metropolitan Government Building (Tocho)
Tokyo.description: Ofrece vistas panorámicas gratuitas de la ciudad desde sus dos observatorios a 202 metros de altura.

Tokyo.name: Santuario Meiji Jingu
Tokyo.description: Santuario sintoísta dedicado a los espíritus deificados del Emperador Meiji y su esposa.

Tokyo.name: Takeshita Street
Tokyo.description: El epicentro de la cultura adolescente y la moda de Harajuku, famosa por sus tiendas y crepes. (touristy shopping street. Not local)

Tokyo.name: Cruce de Shibuya
Tokyo.description: El cruce peatonal más transitado del mundo, un espectáculo de luces de neón y multitudes.

Tokyo.name: Estatua de Hachiko
Tokyo.description: Famosa estatua de bronce que conmemora al leal perro Akita, Hachiko. Punto de encuentro popular.

Tokyo.name: Templo Senso-ji
Tokyo.description: El templo más antiguo de Tokio, en Asakusa, con su icónica linterna roja gigante. (crowded. Instead check gotokuji temple in setagaya)

Tokyo.name: Kaminarimon (Puerta del Trueno)
Tokyo.description: La imponente puerta de entrada al Templo Senso-ji, un símbolo de Asakusa.

Tokyo.name: Parque Ueno
Tokyo.description: Gran parque público que alberga museos, templos y un zoológico.

Tokyo.name: Mercado Ameya Yokocho (Ameyoko)
Tokyo.description: Animado mercado al aire libre que vende de todo, desde mariscos hasta ropa.

Tokyo.name: Estación de Tokio
Tokyo.description: Hito arquitectónico con una hermosa fachada de ladrillo rojo, principal centro de trenes de Japón.

Tokyo.name: Templo Gotokuji
Tokyo.description: Famoso por ser el origen del Maneki-neko (gato de la suerte), con miles de estatuillas de gatos. (less crowded alternative to Senso-ji)

Tokyo.name: Tokyo Skytree
Tokyo.description: La estructura más alta de Japón, con vistas espectaculares desde sus observatorios. (expensive and overcrowded)

Tokyo.name: Palacio Imperial
Tokyo.description: La residencia principal del Emperador de Japón, rodeada de grandes jardines y fosos.

Tokyo.name: 3Coins+plus
Tokyo.description: Tienda popular con artículos para el hogar y accesorios, la mayoría por menos de ¥300.

Tokyo.name: Alinamin Night Recover
Tokyo.description: Bebida de recuperación en 7-Eleven, útil para el jet lag.

Tokyo.name: Nikkō
Tokyo.description: A city in the mountains of Tochigi Prefecture, Nikko is a popular day trip from Tokyo known for its ornate shrines and temples. (Note: A day trip is recommended due to the distance from Tokyo)

Tokyo.name: Kawagoe
Tokyo.description: A city near Tokyo known for its well-preserved Edo-period architecture. (Note: This is a good option for a day trip from Tokyo)

Tokyo.name: Kamakura
Tokyo.description: A coastal city south of Tokyo with numerous Buddhist temples and Shinto shrines.

Tokyo.name: Yokohama
Tokyo.description: A major city south of Tokyo known for its modern architecture and scenic waterfront.

Tokyo.name: Enoshima
Tokyo.description: A small island with hot springs, English-style gardens, a sacred sanctuary, caves, and a lighthouse.

Tokyo.name: Templo Kotoku-in
Tokyo.description: A serene temple famous for its large outdoor bronze statue of a seated Buddha.

Tokyo.name: Engaku-ji
Tokyo.description: A Zen Buddhist complex, founded in 1282, with gates, temples, a giant bell, and a Buddha relic.

Tokyo.name: Templo Hokoku-ji
Tokyo.description: An old temple with a lush bamboo garden and a teahouse serving matcha to visitors.

Tokyo.name: Zeniarai Benten Shrine
Tokyo.description: A cozy, 11th-century Shinto shrine with a spring for ritual money-washing believed to increase wealth.

Tokyo.name: Templo Gōtokuji
Tokyo.description: Edo period Buddhist temple with a large collection of lucky beckoning cat statues. (less crowded alternative to Senso-ji)

Tokyo.name: Starbucks Reserve® Roastery Tokyo
Tokyo.description: A Seattle-based cafe known for its specialty coffees and snacks, with Wi-Fi.

Tokyo.name: Nintendo Tokio
Tokyo.description: The official Nintendo store in Tokyo.

Tokyo.name: RURU SHIBUYA
Tokyo.description: A restaurant in the Shibuya area.

Tokyo.name: Shibuya
Tokyo.description: A famous commercial and entertainment district in Tokyo.

Tokyo.name: Meiji Park
Tokyo.description: A large public park in Tokyo.

Tokyo.name: Templo Zojoji
Tokyo.description: A temple complex with the main temple of the Jodo-shu Buddhist school and ornate 17th-century buildings.

Tokyo.name: Tsukiji Outer Market
Tokyo.description: An extensive fish market with a variety of seafood and areas to watch the famous tuna auction. (touristy)

Tokyo.name: Ginza
Tokyo.description: An upscale shopping, dining, and entertainment district in Tokyo.

Tokyo.name: Santuario Hie
Tokyo.description: A complex of Shinto shrines and gardens that hosts several annual festivals and events.

Tokyo.name: Ayuntamiento de Tokio
Tokyo.description: A government complex with observation decks that offer some of the highest views in the city.

Tokyo.name: SHARI Tokyu Kabukicho Tower
Tokyo.description: A restaurant located in the Tokyu Kabukicho Tower.

Tokyo.name: Omoide Yokochō- Callejón de los Recuerdos
Tokyo.description: An iconic alley with a selection of simple food stalls and alcoholic beverages.

Tokyo.name: Shinjuku
Tokyo.description: A major commercial and administrative center in Tokyo.

Tokyo.name: Hotel Chinzanso Tokyo
Tokyo.description: A refined hotel with several restaurants, lush gardens, a spa, and an indoor pool. Also known as garden above the clouds hotel chinzanso.

Tokyo.name: Akihabara
Tokyo.description: A commercial district famous for its electronics, toys, and manga, as well as its maid cafes.

Tokyo.name: Benitsuru Pancake
Tokyo.description: A selection of sweet & savory pancakes are offered at this easygoing restaurant with counter seats.

Tokyo.name: Asakusa
Tokyo.description: A traditional district with an ancient Buddhist temple, street food stalls, artisan shops, and more.

Tokyo.name: Sensō-ji
Tokyo.description: Tokyo's oldest temple, completed in the year 645, in honor of Kannon, goddess of mercy. (crowded. Instead check gotokuji temple in setagaya)

Tokyo.name: Parque de Ueno
Tokyo.description: An urban park with wide walking paths, a lake with boat rentals, a zoo, and museums.

Tokyo.name: Bar de cocktails Centifolia
Tokyo.description: 30usd cocktails

Tokyo.name: Suzukien Asakusa
Tokyo.description: Matcha ice cream

Tokyo.name: Yanaka
Tokyo.description: Tokyo old world and peaceful neighborhood

Tokyo.name: MAGNET by SHIBUYA109
Tokyo.description: Shibuya viewing deck (mag spark in the elevator) after 11am

Tokyo.name: Maid Cafe
Tokyo.description: In Akihabara. (This is a generic entry, there are many maid cafes in Akihabara)

Tokyo.name: Shimokitazawa
Tokyo.description: boho chick neighborhood with vintage boutiques

Tokyo.name: Tsukishima Monja Street
Tokyo.description: Monjayaki pancakes here. Less touristy

Tokyo.name: Roppongi Hills Mori Tower
Tokyo.description: More chill elevated spot with good view and less crowds

Tokyo.name: Nezu Shrine
Tokyo.description: in Bunkyo for a local experience

Tokyo.name: Odaiba
Tokyo.description: Large artificial island in Tokyo Bay, Japan, across the Rainbow Bridge from central Tokyo.

Tokyo.name: Tokyo Tower
Tokyo.description: Iconic Eiffel-inspired lattice tower with observation decks, offering panoramic city views & a cafe.

Tokyo.description: 4 Chome 7-1 Akasaka, Minato City, Tokyo-to 107-0052, Japan

Kyoto.name: Kiyomizu-dera

Kyoto.name: Otagi Nenbutsu-ji
Kyoto.description: Templo encantador famoso por sus 1,200 estatuas de Rakan con expresiones diferentes.

Kyoto.name: Kinkaku-ji (Pabellón Dorado)
Kyoto.description: Impresionante templo Zen cuyas dos plantas superiores están cubiertas de pan de oro.

Kyoto.name: Ginkaku-ji (Pabellón de Plata)
Kyoto.description: Elegante templo Zen con hermosos jardines de arena y musgo.

Kyoto.name: Palacio Imperial de Kioto
Kyoto.description: Antigua residencia de la Familia Imperial, ubicada en un extenso parque.

Kyoto.name: Torre de Kioto
Kyoto.description: La estructura de acero más alta de Kioto, con vistas de 360 grados.

Kyoto.name: Fushimi Inari-taisha

Kyoto.name: Barrio de Gion
Kyoto.description: El famoso distrito de geishas de Kioto, con casas de té y calles bien conservadas.

Kyoto.description: Estrecha calle comercial con tiendas y restaurantes que venden especialidades locales.

Kyoto.name: Adashino Nenbutsuji Temple
Kyoto.description: Serene hilltop Buddhist temple featuring thousands of carved stone memorial statues.

Kyoto.name: Arashiyama Bamboo Forest
Kyoto.description: A popular sightseeing path runs uphill through this forest of towering bamboo stalks.

Kyoto.name: Tenryu-ji
Kyoto.description: This venerable Zen temple at the foot of mountains features teahouses & serene, expansive gardens.

Kyoto.name: Arashiyama Monkey Park Iwatayama
Kyoto.description: Popular area atop Mt. Arashiyama for viewing wild macaque monkeys & sweeping city views.

Kyoto.name: Ryōan-ji
Kyoto.description: On the scenic grounds of this 15th-century temple is a famous Zen rock garden & a yudofu restaurant.

Kyoto.name: Kinkaku-ji
Kyoto.description: Historic, tranquil temple with a gold-leaf facade set amid landscaped gardens & a reflecting pond.

Kyoto.name: Pontocho Park
Kyoto.description: A small park in the Pontocho alley, a famous district with traditional teahouses and restaurants.

Kyoto.name: Yasaka Shrine
Kyoto.description: A Shinto shrine erected in 656 A.D. & home to one of the most famous festivals in Japan.

Kyoto.name: Gion Misen
Kyoto.description: Relaxed hotel in a townhouse featuring streamlined rooms, artwork & complimentary Wi-Fi.

Kyoto.name: Sannenzaka
Kyoto.description: Bustling pedestrian street on a hill lined with souvenir stalls & traditional Japanese architecture.

Kyoto.name: Sanjūsangendō Temple
Kyoto.description: This iconic Buddhist temple is known for its 1,001 life-sized wooden statues of the goddess Kannon.

Kyoto.name: Ginkaku-ji
Kyoto.description: This 15th-century Zen temple features picturesque gardens & a sand mound shaped like Mount Fuji.

Kyoto.name: Kibune River
Kyoto.description: The Kibune River is famous for its Kibune Kawadoko restaurants, where visitors can enjoy meals on platforms built over the river.

Kyoto.name: Hirobun
Kyoto.description: Delicately presented banquet menus at a charming spot with tatami flooring & overlooking a weir.

Kyoto.name: Hōkan-ji Temple (Yasaka Pagoda)
Kyoto.description: A landmark five-story pagoda in the Higashiyama District, offering beautiful views of the traditional neighborhood.

Kyoto.name: Kodaiji Temple

Kyoto.name: Nanzen-ji
Kyoto.description: A Zen Buddhist temple with expansive grounds and a notable brick aqueduct running through the temple precincts.

Kyoto.name: Hōnenin Temple
Kyoto.description: A tranquil temple known for its moss-covered thatched gate and the beautiful sand mounds in its entrance.

Kyoto.name: Rental Kimono Okamoto Gion Shop
Kyoto.description: A popular shop for renting traditional kimonos for sightseeing in Kyoto's historic Gion district.

Kyoto.name: Ninenzaka
Kyoto.description: A charming, preserved stone-paved pedestrian street lined with traditional shops, restaurants, and teahouses.

Kyoto.name: Hanamikoji-dori
Kyoto.description: The most famous street in Gion, known for its traditional wooden machiya houses and the chance to spot geishas.

Kyoto.name: Yasaka Kōshin-dō Temple
Kyoto.description: A small, colorful temple famous for the thousands of 'kukurizaru' balls hanging on its grounds.

Kyoto.name: Togetsukyō Bridge
Kyoto.description: A famous landmark bridge in Arashiyama, offering scenic views of the mountains and Hozugawa River.

Kyoto.name: Sagano romantic train
Kyoto.description: A scenic sightseeing train that runs along the Hozugawa River between Arashiyama and Kameoka.

Kyoto.name: Jojakkoji Temple
Kyoto.description: A serene temple on a mountainside in Arashiyama, known for its stunning autumn colors and tranquil atmosphere.

Kyoto.name: Gekkeikan Ōkura Sake Museum
Kyoto.description: A museum showcasing the history of sake brewing by the Gekkeikan company, with tastings available.

Kyoto.name: Kenninji Temple

Kyoto.name: Tōfuku-ji Temple
Kyoto.description: A large Zen temple particularly famous for its spectacular autumn colors viewed from the Tsutenkyo Bridge.

Kyoto.name: Daigoji Temple

Kyoto.name: Shojuin Temple
Kyoto.description: Known for its heart-shaped window and colorful ceiling paintings, offering a unique and picturesque experience.

Kyoto.name: Mamemono to Taiyaki - Kodaiji Store
Kyoto.description: A popular shop specializing in taiyaki (fish-shaped cakes) and other sweets, located near Kodaiji Temple.

Kyoto.name: Gion Kitagawa Hanbee
Kyoto.description: A restaurant in the historic Gion district offering traditional Kyoto cuisine in an elegant setting.

Kyoto.name: Byodo-in Hoodo

Kyoto.name: Airbnb Kyoto

Osaka.name: Mercado Kuromon

Osaka.name: Noria Hep Five
Osaka.description: Gran noria roja en un centro comercial, con excelentes vistas.

Osaka.name: Barco Santa María

Osaka.name: Namba

Osaka.name: Katsuoji

Osaka.name: Dekasan

Osaka.name: Doutonbori Street

Hiroshima.description: A large park in central Hiroshima, dedicated to the legacy of the atomic bombing.

Hiroshima.name: Atomic Bomb Dome
Hiroshima.description: The skeletal ruins of the former Prefectural Industrial Promotion Hall, a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

Hiroshima.name: Miyajima Island
Hiroshima.description: A scenic island outside of Hiroshima, best known for its floating torii gate and wild deer.

Hiroshima.name: Itsukushima Shrine
Hiroshima.description: A famous Shinto shrine on Miyajima Island, known for its iconic 'floating' torii gate.

Hiroshima.name: Hiroshima Castle
Hiroshima.description: A reconstruction of the original 16th-century castle, which was destroyed in the atomic bombing.
